title: Integrate browser history into day recap
description:
## Summary

Add browser history as a complementary data source to CASS sessions, filling the ~40% of work activity that happens outside Claude Code (PR reviews, Jira triage, manual testing, Confluence research, DevOps tools).

## Approach

### Script: `scripts/browser_history.py`

A simple extraction script that runs during Phase 1. No filtering — the AI handles that.

**Input:** `--date YYYY-MM-DD` and `--output path`
**Data source:** Chromium `visits` table joined with `urls` table (Edge or Chrome)

Key design decisions:
- Use `visits` table (not `urls`) — gives every individual page visit with its own timestamp
- Include `visit_duration` (microseconds) — the killer field that distinguishes "glanced at for 0s" (auth redirect) from "spent 5 minutes reading" (PR diff review)
- Copy the History DB to a temp location first (browser locks it while running)
- Insert visual gap markers when >30 min between visits (natural context switches)
- Auto-detect Edge vs Chrome (Edge path first, fallback to Chrome)
- Handle Windows cp1252 encoding — write to UTF-8 file, don't print to console

**Output format:**
```
BROWSER HISTORY: 2026-02-10
Source: Edge | 397 visits | 142 unique URLs

01:29 |  45s | Gabko14/day-summary: Claude Code skill...     | https://github.com/...
01:30 | 180s | Dicklesworthstone/coding_agent_session_search  | https://github.com/...

--- GAP: 14 hours ---

15:34 |   0s | statics.teams.cdn.office.net (safelink)       | https://statics...
15:34 |  95s | [LEON-3057] Stammdaten > Pflichtfelder...      | https://jira.ims.ch/...
```

### SKILL.md Changes

**Phase 1:** Add browser history extraction call:
```bash
python ~/.claude/skills/day-summary/scripts/browser_history.py \
  --date YYYY-MM-DD \
  --output ~/Desktop/browser-history-YYYY-MM-DD.txt
```

**Phase 2:** Add one more haiku reader that gets the browser history file:
- Prompt: "Read this browser history with visit durations. Identify work activities NOT already covered by Claude Code sessions. Group repeated visits into single activities. Use visit_duration to distinguish meaningful visits from noise (auth redirects = 0s, real work = 30s+). Focus on: PR reviews, Jira issues, manual testing, Confluence, DevOps tools."
- The main agent merges browser activities into the timeline, filling gaps between CASS sessions

### Implementation Notes

- Query: `SELECT v.visit_time, v.visit_duration, u.url, u.title FROM visits v JOIN urls u ON v.url = u.id WHERE v.visit_time BETWEEN ? AND ? ORDER BY v.visit_time`
- Chromium epoch offset: 11644473600 * 1000000 (Jan 1, 1601 in microseconds)
- Edge path: `~/AppData/Local/Microsoft/Edge/User Data/Default/History`
- Chrome path: `~/AppData/Local/Google/Chrome/User Data/Default/History`
- Temp copy needed because browser locks the SQLite file
- Don't use os.remove() — DCG blocks it. Leave temp file for manual cleanup or use trash

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] `browser_history.py` extracts all visits for a given date with duration
- [ ] Gap markers inserted for 30+ min gaps
- [ ] Works on Windows (Edge + Chrome fallback)
- [ ] SKILL.md updated with browser history extraction step
- [ ] SKILL.md updated with browser history reader subagent prompt
- [ ] Tested end-to-end: browser history fills gaps in a real day recap
close_reason: Browser history is already integrated — script exists and SKILL.md references it
